intro: Verbesina tequendamensis, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant has palmately lobed leaves that are often hairy and grayish in appearance. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
